alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 2:58AM CDT until March 31 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT FOR GENEVA COUNTY... At 258 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hartford, or 8 miles northeast of Geneva, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Geneva, Hartford, Slocomb, Malvern, Coffee Springs, Black, Chancellor, Spears, Fadette, Kellys Crossroads, Eunola, Lytle, High Bluff, Highfalls, Marl, Dundee, Bald Hill, Geneva Municipal A/P, Vaughanville and Hendrix Crossroad. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for southeastern Alabama. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
